TopicTitle: What did you do in KSP1 today?

Articles.Content: Hahaha she was the one wanted to you knoe...:P I would lve to have a girlfriend but where i live, girls lie about soooo much , im swedish but swedish girls isnt that nice that eveonre thinks

Installed InfiniteDice's Boat Parts (R3 version) and had a lot of fun with it

Still trying to land in a carrier though.
I bought KSP today, and tried to at least make it out of the atmosphere with my ship. I love this game, and can't wait to do more tomorrow.

Finally fixed the flat tire on my road bike and so YAY, first ride out in two weeks. Yes this is KSP related--people should take breaks, esp. exercise breaks, from KSP--it's generally not good to keep KSPing every free break or moment you have (caused me migraines).
I received the perfect Father's Day present.

Well...

I built some stuff:

I broke some stuff:

I landed some stuff:

I docked some stuff:

And I burnt some stuff:

Okay, so maybe I didn't do quite all of it today.

Sue me.

Built a freakishly big 125 ton rocket (biggest I've ever built!) and sent Billy-Bobny Kerman on Moho.

Lander went explodey, but B-B survived.

i re-created the goonstation from Scott Manley. link: http: //www./?eaoi3iwygx1hvn4

Edited June 16, 2013 by jhggygh

I finally managed to SSTO some orange tanks to space

Dispatched one tank near Eve too. Half empty though. +Sent a probe to Eve surface.
Variable geometry wings:

Well, first I built a probe to go study the sun at a distance of ~1000Mm

The Helios I undocked from its insertion craft and that's where the problem lay. Can anybody work it out? from this picture?

yup, I forgot that I would be needing to burn 'side-on' to the Sun, so more than half the solar arrays were useless.

A brief sacking of staff at KSC later the Helios II set off on its epic journey:

I'm never-ever using ion drives again, though! the two ion burns must have taken ~ 4 hours in total on 4x zoom. Fortunately I had some writing to be getting on with so I left it to crawl painfully slowly towards the sun in the background while I got on with work.

I began a new Laythe colonization endeavour, and put the first few smaller parts onto the surface.

I also moved my airship to Laythe orbit, but it's run out of fuel now, so I'm kinda stuck there until I can send a refueling tanker.

I made a flyable (still need some tweaks for reaching orbit) SpaceShip One:

Assisted takeoff using SRBs:

After the SRBs end and are deplyoed, the ship files using it's own SABRE engine:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I did ALL of that TODAY! It's still 6:27 though
After a few tweaks, the SpaceShip One made to orbit:
Today I flew one of my tougher dockings. The core of my semi-successful interplanetary ship (left) met the drive section of my new ship (right) to transfer fuel.
Finished editing/uploading a video using the same scenario as the 'Dock with no RCS' challenge I'd done a while ago:
Dropped Jeb in a truck onto the North Pole. Just cuz.

Landed my lander at Mun (Was coming in too fast and my landing legs tore off), planted a flag for the Terran Republic (FTW!) and then proceeded to launch my lander into the closest orbit to the surface on Mun.

Pretty awesome

Edited June 17, 2013 by AntonioAJC

Today? Today Jeb returned the Cuairt-1, first mÃƒÂ¼nar lander in my "campaign" game, from the Armstrong Memorial to mÃƒÂ¼nar orbit where he rendezvoused with Buzz and Harler in the command module, Fios-1. They then shoved off for Kerbin, leaving the Cuairt-1 behind as a mÃƒÂ¼nar observatory.

Once back in Kerbin orbit I discovered that I'd run the "cold equations" a bit too precisely... only had a tenth of a unit of fuel after our Kerbin de-orbit burn. Still managed to land within a few kilometers of KSC.
After a few tries, I made a proper SpaceShipOne with the White Knight Assist Vehicle and all. Now I need to make the whole thing stable.

Had a game of "Angry Kerbs".

This concept needs further development.

Sent up two of my deep space fuel rigs, rendezvoued them in order to transfer fuel, attempted and failed to dock and then I realised I'd mounted my docking ports around the wrong way........

So I deorbited both of them, and I'll try that one again tomorrow. My Kerbanauts are waiting in space for their fuel rig

I had the first testrun with my heavy Cargo Plane.

I think there might still be some "minor" issues i need to fix.
Decided to land in the mountains on Minimus instead of the plains like usual. Jeb found a canal. Or maybe the equator. (Or maybe just a graphical glitch...)
